SEARCH
Package util

Class ListMethods<E>

java.lang.Object
util.List
util.ListMethods<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of elements in the list
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable
public class ListMethods<E> extends List
A utility class that provides methods for working with lists of generic elements, specifically handling appointments, timeslots, and formatting.
Author:
Raashi Maheshwari, Tanvi Yamarty

  • Method Details

    • identifyAppointment

      public int identifyAppointment(Profile profile, Date date, Timeslot timeslot, List<E> appList)
      Identifies the index of an appointment in the list based on profile, date, and timeslot.
      Parameters:
      profile - The profile of the person associated with the appointment.
      date - The date of the appointment.
      timeslot - The timeslot of the appointment.
      appList - The list of elements (appointments) to search through.
      Returns:
      The index of the appointment in the list if found, or NOT_FOUND (-1) if not found.

    • timeslotTaken

      public int timeslotTaken(Provider provider, Timeslot timeslot, List<E> appList)
      Checks if a timeslot is already taken for a specific provider.
      Parameters:
      provider - The provider whose timeslot availability is being checked.
      timeslot - The timeslot being checked.
      appList - The list of appointments to search through.
      Returns:
      The index of the appointment if the timeslot is taken, or NOT_FOUND (-1) if not taken.

    • formatTimeslot

      public String formatTimeslot(int slotNumber)
      Formats the timeslot into a readable string format.
      Parameters:
      slotNumber - The timeslot number to format.
      Returns:
      A string representing the formatted timeslot, or an error message if the slot is invalid.

    • formatDate

      private String formatDate(Appointment appointment)
      Formats the date of an appointment into a "MM/DD/YYYY" format.
      Parameters:
      appointment - The appointment whose date is to be formatted.
      Returns:
      A string representing the formatted date.
